result.execSummary:
The defendant Artist D.C. Vinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure  to pay will result in a civil judgment: all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA; all applicable fees of supervision.
Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
If revoked, all court costs, surcharges to be paid through collection by DOC.  Percentage or amount to be determined by DOC under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm; also advised that she may not vote until her civil rights have been restored.

No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs.
No contact with codefendant Kyawn Lewis.

Random urine screens.
Follow all rules of supervisoin.
Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Assessment/financial screens-printouts
Letter in support of the defendant received and filed.

Defendant Artist D.C. Vinson in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Laura Crivello for Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated on the record State modifies previous negotiations without objection from defense.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  6 YEARS with 6 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS. 

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and/or the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.

  Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:

- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with: Co defendant Kyawn Lewis.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied 
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections percentage or amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections. under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of her right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that she may not vote until her civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement

Defendant Artist D.C. Vinson in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Katherine Seelow for Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Case in court to address Justice Point violation.  Court admonishes the defendant, but does not amend bail.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22 for sentencing on 04/08/2016 at 8:30am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  Diluted drug test.  Parties contacted to schedule bail review.  Bail review scheduled on 03/10/2016 for 03/14/2016 at 8:30am in Branch 22.

Defendant Artist D.C. Vinson in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for jury trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Pursuant to negotiations, Count 5 is DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  As to Count 4: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
